intro: Parasenecio quinquelobus, commonly known as the five-lobed parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often growing in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
